ul.li: Over $5.6 million scholarships awarded to seniors at Hickory High and Hickory Career & Arts Magnet

div.p: The mission of the Hickory Public Schools is to develop within each learner the skills to be a responsible citizen and have a lifelong love of learning.

By connecting with and engaging each member of the learning community, Hickory Public Schools will ensure a high quality education for all students preparing them to become responsible, productive citizens

ul.li: Superior ratings in Foard Band Classic, Southeastern Classic and Foothills Invitational
First place music & percussion in Foard Band Classic, Southeastern Classic and Foothills Invitational
Band of the Day in Southeastern Classic & Foothills Invitational
Extensive Advanced Placement & Honor Level Course Offerings
Digital Learning (1-1 digital conversion in grades 6-12)
Dual-Language Immersion Program at Southwest Primary and Viewmont Elementary
Award winning Career & Technical Education Program
Northview Middle designated as a National Schools To Watch by National Forum for Middle Grades Reform
Longview Elementary identified as a Beta School of Merit
Jenkins Elementary identified as a North Carolina School To Watch in partnership with NCSBA and ReContext Data Solutions

div.p: 1 primary school, 4 elementary schools, 2 middle schools, 1 high school and 1 magnet school
41.49% White; 24.68% Hispanic; 20.95% Black; 8.52% Two or More Races; 4.21% Asian; 0.12% American Indian or Alaska Native; 0.02% Pacific Islander

ul.li: 2015 Hickory High Women’s Basketball 3A State Champions
Hickory High awarded Conference Wachovia Cup for three straight years signifying the top sports program in the conference

div.span: Hickory Public Schools (HPS) retains control over what links will be placed on system-related websites; however, the linked sites themselves are not under the control of the school system, its agents, or its employees. HPS is not responsible for the contents of any linked site, any link contained in a linked site, or any changes or updates to such sites. HPS provides links as a convenience, and the inclusion of any link does not imply endorsement of the site by the school system. HPS reserves the right to remove or restrict any links. HPS is in the process of reviewing this website to ensure compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. If you have questions or concerns regarding the accessibility of the website or if you are unable to access a page or document on the website, you may email website@hickoryschools.net or call (828) 322-2855.
